states: Sessile but not auriculate or amplexicaul
characters.name: Base of stem (cauline) leaves (no state if all leaves basal)
Divisions and margins of stem leaves (if stem leaves absent, examine basal leaves)

states: Racemes that are bracteate throughout or at least in lower half
Racemes that are ebracteate or rarely lowermost 1 or 2 flowers bracteate
Solitary flowers borne on pedicels originating from basal rosette
characters.name: Inflorescences flower arrangement in

states: Filaments with a wing, tooth, or appendage
Petal claw and/or filament with hairs or papillae
characters.name: Lower part of filaments and petal claws

states: United at least along lower third
characters.name: Filaments of median stamens

states: Included within calyx or partially exserted
Exserted well above sepals and petals
characters.name: Stamens position

states: Silique (fruit more than 3 times longer than broad)
Silicle (fruit up to 3 times longer than broad)
characters.name: Fruit a (length-width ratio)

states: Angustiseptate (flattened at a right angle to septum)
Terete (not flattened, cylindrical (circular in cross section))
Quadrangular (4-angled (square or rectangular in cross section))
characters.name: Fruit flattening

states: Fruit breaks up into closed, 1- or few-seeded segments (schizocarp, loment, or segmented)
characters.name: Fruit dehiscence

states: At least 1.5 mm long, usually much longer
Absent or rarely to 1 mm long
characters.name: Gynophore in fruit

states: Lacking or reduced to a narrow rim
Complete or rarely with a hole
characters.name: Septum in mature fruit

states: Aseriate (not in rows: when fruit has one or a few seeds)
characters.name: Seed arrangement per locule
Seed mucilage (when seeds soaked in water for a few minutes)

states: Zygomorphic (two petals and/or sepals much larger than other two)
characters.name: Flowers symmetry

states: All flowers bisexual (with stamens and pistils)
characters.name: Sex
